alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 6:55AM MST until August 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR TONTO CREEK IN GILA COUNTY... At 654 AM MST, gauge reports indicate runoff from thunderstorms producing heavy rain yesterday has caused a significant rise in stream flow. Action stage was reached at Tonto Creek near Roosevelt, but has now dropped below action stage at roughly 6:15 AM MST. The Flash Flood Warning has been extended for areas downstream of this gauge as flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Gila County including Tonto Basin and Tonto Creek. This includes the following highways... State Route 188 near mile marker 268. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
